measured_by: five-item multiple-choice digital literacy questionnaire (score = number correct)
justification: “Participants first completed…measures of digital literacy (five multiple choice questions; scored as number of correct answers)”

measured_by: two 7-point Likert scales on hearing/reading about and using generative AI tools
justification: “familiarity with generative AI (two seven-point Likert scales asking about how much the participant has heard/read about, and used, generative AI).”

measured_by: two 7-point Likert scales rating negativity–positivity toward content and its poster
justification: “To measure negative versus positive feelings towards the content and its poster, we used two 7-point Likert scales…Very Negative…Neutral…Very Positive.”

measured_by: single 7-point Likert scale on how a label changes likelihood the events actually happened
justification: “If you saw an image or video online that was labeled <term>, to what extent would the label make you less likely to think that the events shown…actually occurred? (Likert scale: 1 ‘I would definitely NOT think the events occurred’ to 7 ‘No effect…’).”

measured_by: alignment score from classifying 20 content descriptions against ground-truth categories
justification: “a given participant's responses are turned into an alignment score by determining the fraction of responses that correspond with our specified ‘correct’ responses…We then calculate average alignment for each term.”
